Hoosiers, let’s take action against Trump-Pence’s mass-deportation machine.
  


County Commissioner Meeting

Monday, August 20, 3 p.m.
Newton County Government Center
4117 S 240 W.
Morocco, IN 47963

RSVP TODAY
Share this:           

Dear ACLU Supporter,

For the past three decades, the immigration detention population has increased dramatically, reaching historic highs. To manage the growing detainee population, ICE has increasingly turned to contracted facilities, such as for-profit prison corporations.

With no one to hold them accountable, private immigration detention centers maintain a particularly grisly track record of detainee abuse and neglect. The nation’s second largest for-profit prison operator, Geo Group, has proposed to ICE to build a federal for-profit immigrant detention center in Newton County. However, we the people, have the chance to take action against it.

On Monday, August 20 at 3 p.m. county commissioners will meet to discuss the project at the Newton County Government Center in Morocco, Indiana. Join local activists, organizers and community members to ask the commissioners for a zoning amendment to restrict the prison from being built in Newton County.

Contract facilities operate outside of public oversight and explicitly violate the rights of detainees, giving momentum to Trump’s mass-deportation machine. Now more than ever, we must fight back against the injustices within our immigration system.

Tell your friends and take action with us!

Forward together,

ACLU of Indiana

RSVP TODAY
